tool.name: MS-GF+ output to Pin converter
tool.command: msgf2pin -o $pinout -m $matches -e $enzyme #if $matches -m $matches #end if #if $aafreq -a #end if #if $ptm -b #end if #if $pngase -M #end if #if $isotope -N #end if "$target" "$decoy"

param.name: target
param.label: Target MSGF+ results or metafile pointing to them

param.name: decoy
param.label: Decoy MSGF+ results or metafile pointing to them

param.name: matches
param.label: Max number of PSMs for a spectrum

param.name: ptm
param.label: Calculate feature for number of PTMs

param.name: pngase
param.label: Calculate feature based on N-linked glycosylation resulting from PNGaseF

param.name: isotope
param.label: Calculate mass differnce to closest isotope instead of avg. mass

tool.help: The percolator converter msgf2pin converts mzIdentML to input for percolator. Target and decoy inputs are MzIdentML-files of MS-GF+ from separate target and decoy searches. Internal MS-GF+ target/decoy analysis should be turned off, and the addFeatures options turned on. Multiple MzIdentML-files can be merged by replacing target and decoy filepaths with meta files. Meta files are text files containing the the paths of mzid-files, one path per line. For successful results, the different runs should be generated under similar conditions.
